intro: Veratrum, commonly known as false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. These plants are characterized by their tall, hollow stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in late summer. They are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including North America and Europe. The leaves are usually broad, lance-shaped, and often have a waxy coating. Veratrum species contain various alkaloids, some of which have been used in traditional medicine and modern pharmacology.
